message:
Beginner content is increasing. Should we limit it, given beginners -although are sort-of allowed in- are not the intended audience of the group?
* The question is for experienced members and admins, not for beginner members *
story: Meligy created a poll in Egyptian Geeks.

data.message:
I vote for removing posts whose owner obviously has not bothered to even google their issue.

Examples -at the top of my head-:
- value vs. reference parameters
- changing exe resources
- database related exception

Those are what sites like stackoverflow are for. Personally, I came here for geeky discussions/news or even personal projects. The keyword is "geek".

Just my humble opinion.
Such an Egyptian question!! We love to discriminate! The question should be exactly what Ahmed said above, rather than discouraging people who want to learn from posting.
eh da ana mesh msd2 el so2al da!

Sherif Omar We try to maintain Quality over Quantity in our Group and that's why we are not any random Forum or group and this is all the efforts of all the members in here and the admins. Allowing someone to post something without even bothering to google it is useless because:

1. He actually don't want to learn anything, He wants you to solve his problem so at least you should charge him :)

2. You are not helping him at all! you are giving him a chance to be more lazy.

3. If he doesn't learn how to research and use his head what you are expecting from him.

4. You have the Top people in the industry here in out group, Make use of them otherwise you will be like A man/girl who has a Mercedes and he use it transport vegetables!

That's why we should not allow Random stuff in our group.

Funny thing about discrimination and not encouraging.
In short, you can think of any filter as discrimination, but I think you are using the word in the wrong context.
Our *role* and the reason we are here is not encouraging beginners. We can send them to more beginner friendly group. We can even start one ourselves. This is not the point. Nobody said be rude to beginners and tell them they are stupid. Some day some of them will be pros, maybe more than all of us
Amr Eldib good point and wrong phrasing on my part. I mean beginner questions not beginner content in general
Although after another thought , we have been rejecting a lot of beginner content in general for a while already
I vote for removing beginners but when they got more than that.

In my opinion, removing beginner content is wrong direction, because group is generally open, if admins want to remove beginners then they should ask for minimum requirements to be in the group. In fact, this question is extremely important and should be asked from along ago! Whats the purpose and direction of this group. (Closed group of  Uber Geeks, or Open Group for every one interested)
N.B: Most famous geek communities and sites accept beginner content because simply its a part/step that cannot be ignored.

From the very beginning most admins agreed that beginner content providers and groups are everywhere. Once you get past that, it's very hard to find a place which is not full of basic information only.

Somehow, not sure whether by conscious admin effort or accidentally, more advanced  members joined and this place became an elite one that's different from all (respectable and useful, and many) beginner groups/sites.

As we got biggerr, more beginners were interested in joining. They were welcome as watchers, but recently this is changing the nature of the group with their contributions, which may be good, but not for this very group.

"Discrimination" is a really tough word in this context! You want to help "beginners"? Help them in communities created for that purpose.

The way I see it, beginners won't die if this group eliminates their content and they -if they really want to learn- will find other places where they will get more help than we can even provide, but this group will die if we got too much "beginner content".

I think this problem generated as a result of fb limitation and lack of bunch of features such as categorization + can we define carefully what kind of posts that are allowed here (i mean if you surf the timeline you find a very vast types of posts)
I say, remove the beginner content, keep the beginner user, and he will still learn from the content posted and one day he will contribute good content

And it is because of the facebook limitations that this problem has rised.

Take Stack Overflow for example, what they did was brilliant, they eliminated the "noise".

Before SO, you would have had to browse through forum thread pages, with all people saying "yes that's my problem too" and not really find a solution for the problem you are trying to solve. SO created a comprehensive community based reputation system to squeeze out only the "good content" and to make "noise" less "visible" and less "important". If that's "discrimination", I want it please :)

In my opinion, for this group the "noise" is "beginner content". And if you keep the "noise" one day it will end this group!

Another example of a system designed to eliminate noise is Reddit!
I've been lurking or various subreddits for some time and I really started to like their self-moderating system, moderators still interfere but it's much less often than with regular forums, some subreddits also allow categories [Like This] in the title and people can get flairs that describe them.
I always felt that this group would be great as a subreddit but sadly reddit is very uncommon in Egypt so we will be severely limiting the audience :\

This group -or any else for that matter- has no obligation to do a certain task in the community. I mean it is really wasteful to create yet another beginner QA group for the sole purpose of avoiding alleged discrimination. 1- it is not discrimination, 2- is this group is capable of competing with stackoverflow, or are we just wasting time and pretending to be helpful and indiscriminate?

30 Yes - 7 No
مُحَمَّد أبو آدم happy to consider this the answer?
My opinion is the results of all the Poll ;-) I always respect the votes of everyone and this is how we maintain our community :)

We are not totally ignoring beginners. we will not permit lazy questions that you can google and get benefit. but if someone asks i would like to learn whatever Technology and which path we should recommend we should always give the hand and help.

So, I think this will depend on us As Mohamed Meligy mentioned. and as you also mentioned Amr "like: how do I install Visual Studio?" Well you can open youtube and you can get thousands of videos. but even basic questions like I need help to know how to make a class in whatever language you saw it your self that we all jump and help :) it's not selfish. It would be our homework to write a good group policy maybe to explain this part.

I think we have to define too if Questions are allowed as stackoverflow type questions? or it's only a group for content/opinions/discussions just like HN?
I'm for being something like HN.
everybody is beginner in something and beginner is always relative idea, i think that everybody should ask more as beginners to strengthen the basics and help others in my modest opinion :3
Ramzy, seriously, the answer to that is that is that there're bazillion groups/forums for that, and **more importantly** this answer has been expressed by at least 3 different people in comments.
sorry :3

اولا حضرتك اظن انك مش عايش ف مصر بالنسبة حضرتك للمبتدئين طبعا الجروب لل Geeks بس ف الآخر ديه ناس فاهمة و اغلبهم مصريين يعني واحد مبتدئ ممكن ياخد منهم المعلومة بثقة بلس ان البمتدئ ده لما بيصد قيلاقي حد يستفسر منه و خاصة اغلبهم بيكونو كليات حاسبات مش يقدرواا يسألوا دكاترة او معيدين عشان الدكاترة اساسا ملهاش ادني خبرة ف التقنيات النازلة الجديدة اغلبهم اخر لغة ال C حضرتك بتقول ف جروبات كتييرة والله العظيم 90% من الجروبات ديه مش شغاله اساساا و اللي بيسأل هنا ف كومنتات بتوجه لل stack overflow هو بالمنطق لو انجليزته قوية و يقدر يفهم ز يستوعب الموجود هناك كان سأل هنا !! اظن حضرتك لو عملت Roll في الجروب هتلاقي اسئلة ال Beginner مش مكملين ال 20% ف معني ان حضرتك تمنع حاجة زي كده يبقى كأنك بتقفل عليه طريق ممكن يكون سلمة لبداية مستقبله
